question.title: Three Way Partition
question.content:
You are given an array consisting of N positive integers and a range [A, B], where A and B are two integers. You have to modify the array such that the following conditions are satisfied:

1. All the elements of the array strictly smaller than ‘a’ should come first.
2. All the elements of the array between the range [a, b] should come next.
3. All the elements of the array strictly greater than ‘b’ should come last.
Input Format :
The first line of the input contains an integer T denoting the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains three space-separated integers N, A, B, denoting the size of the array, the first element of the range, and the second element of the range [a, b] respectively.

The second line of each test case contains N space-separated integers representing the elements of the array.
Output Format :
The output of the test case will be “Correct” if you have modified the array correctly else it will be “Incorrect” without quotes. 
The output of each test case will be printed in a separate line.
Note :
You do not need to print anything, it has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints :
1 <= T <= 5
1 <= N <= 5000
0 <= arr[i] <= 10^9
0 <= a, b <= 10^9
Sample Input 1 :
1
5 2 3
2 0 1 3 4
Sample Output 1 :
Correct
Explanation for Sample Output 1:
After modifying the array according to the given condition, we will get 0 1 2 3 4 .
Since this element array satisfies the required properties, so we will get output as Correct.
Sample Input 2 :
1
5 4 6
1 3 5 7 9
Sample Output 2 :
Correct

rephrased.body: Given an array of positive integers and a range [A, B], reorder the array such that all elements less than A come first, followed by elements within the range [A, B], and finally, elements greater than B.

testcases.explanation: The correctly partitioned array would be [0, 1, 2, 3, 4], which satisfies the given conditions (elements < 2 come first, then elements between 2 and 3, then elements > 3).

The correctly partitioned array would be [1, 3, 5, 7, 9] after three way partitioning, which satisfies the given conditions (elements < 4 come first, then elements between 4 and 6, then elements > 6).
The correctly partitioned array could be [2, 1, 5, 4, 8, 9], which satisfies the given conditions.
The correctly partitioned array would be [10, 20, 30, 40], satisfying the conditions as all are less than A.
The correctly partitioned array would be [50, 60, 70, 80], satisfying the conditions as all are greater than B.

hints: Try to use the simplest possible approach.
